results.title: Next door
results.brief_description: Based on a Kurt Vonnegut Jr story. A young boy left home alone while his parents attend a movie overhears an argument bvetween the couple in the house next door. The boy, becoming increasingly disturbed by the dispute, intervenes in an unusual way. Starring James Wood as the father of the young boy.

results.title: Newton: the mind that found the future
results.creator_credit: International Cinemedia Center, John Kemeny and George Kaczender
results.brief_description: Looks at the life of Sir Isaac newton, his contributions to scientific knowledge and the implications of his work for present-day science. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Newsreel Nostalgia
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of nine Cinesound Review and Movietone News newsreels. A history of the newsreel industry in Australia from its beginnings in 1908 up to its demise due to television. The newsreels in this compilation range from the opening of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Phar Lap, Damien Parer’s 1942 ‘Kokoda Frontline’, Miss Australia finalists 1945, the Petrov affair, to the Beatles tour in Australia.

results.title: Newspapers: a reading adventure
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: Presents an explanation of the various sections of a newspaper. Shows how a story is gathered and written; the types of articles that are printed; and how to read a paper for maximum information.

results.title: Newspaper story. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: This is a comprehensive documentation of a day in the life of a large American metropolitan newspaper, the “Los Angeles Times”. Included are roles of political and sports reporters, cartoonists, photographers, music critics, recipe testers. Advertising layouts, editing processes, proof reading. Computer techniques in type-setting and printing are also shown.

results.title: Newspaper story
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the production of a of newspaper, following a human interest story from the moment a reporter first learns about it, until it appears in print on the front page. Illustrates the skills and duties of the various workers ranging from journalists, editors, copywriters and proof readers to typesetters and technicians. Shows the huge presses and mechanical devices used to produce the daily newspaper. A valuable insight into the printing techniques that were used in the middle of the 20th century.

results.title: Newspaper layout
results.brief_description: Presents the fundamental principles of newspaper layout to improve readability. Focuses on the following four areas: harmonious layout and eye appealing balance; effective use of white space; accenting hot spots; and eliminating ornamentation. Provides tips such as removing zig-zag meandering type, writing crisp sentences, selecting and cropping photographs and recommendations on font type and size.

results.title: Newsfront [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, David Elfick, Richard Brennan and Phil Noyce
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Palm Beach Pictures, David Elfick, Richard Brennan and Phil Noyce

results.title: Newsfront
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, David Elfick, Richard Brennan, Phil Noyce and Bob Ellis
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the newsreel cameramen who lived and worked in Australia during the golden era of the newsreel from 1948 to 1956. Len Maguire (Bill Hunter) is a top cameraman whose devotion to his work and loyalty to his company creates conflict with both his colleagues and the people he loves. Amy (Wendy Hughes) is a production assistant working in a predominantly male environment and Len’s brother, Frank, (Gerard Kennedy) heads the Australian branch of an American newsreel company in competition with Len’s company.
